meanings.sent1: The insentience of the rock made it unaware of the passing time.
meanings.sent2: The insentience of the plant allowed it to grow without knowing it was being watered.
meanings.sent3: The insentience of the teddy bear led to it missing out on all the fun adventures of the other toys.
meanings.sent4: In the insentience of the night, the city slept peacefully, unaware of the bustling day ahead.
meanings.sent5: The insentience of the computer screen made it oblivious to the fascinating websites it displayed.

meanings.definition: The state of being devoid of sensation or feeling.
meanings.sent1: The insentience of the numb hand puzzled the child as he tried to feel the cold snow.
meanings.sent2: The insentience of the stone made it impossible for it to feel the gentle touch of the stream.
meanings.sent3: The insentience of the pillow made it the perfect choice for the restless sleeper.
meanings.sent4: In the insentience of the desert, the sand dunes remained unmoved by the scorching sun.
meanings.sent5: The insentience of the robot's metal body prevented it from experiencing the warmth of a hug.
